author: Staff Reporter
text:
Ultra sonogram facility has been established at four government health centres in Arcot. The upgraded Primary Health Centre (PHC), Pudhupadi, urban PHC in Arcot and PHCs in Timiri and Kaniyambadi have got the ultra sonogram equipment at a cost of Rs. 7.5 lakh each with funds from the Arcot Member of Legislative Assembly (MLA) Constituency Development Scheme, according to a press release.

School Education Minister K.C. Veeramani launched the facilities on Saturday. He said the scan equipment would help people living in rural areas to identify diseases early without having the need to travel to urban areas. It will help pregnant women to scan the foetus free of cost.

Arcot MLA R. Srinivasan was present at the inauguration, the release said.
title: Ultra sonogram facility set up in four PHCs
